snippet: The Labor Department said consumer prices increased 0.3 percent last month, helped by rising gasoline prices. Inflation continued to outpace workers’ earnings, however.
abstract: Labor Department reports that consumer prices increased 0.3 percent in March, as signs mount that a spike in gasoline costs is ebbing, but notes that inflation still outpaced worker's earnings.
lead_paragraph: The Labor Department said consumer prices increased 0.3 percent last month, helped by rising gasoline prices. Inflation continued to outpace workers’ earnings, however.

headline.seo: Consumer Prices Rose Moderately in March
headline.main: Inflation Is Outrunning The Earnings of Workers
headline.print_headline: Inflation Is Outrunning The Earnings of Workers
